channel.title: Introduction on Jumpstart Academy: Building Blocks of the Web
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on Jumpstart Academy: Building Blocks of the Web

item.title: What's a Web Page?
item.description: The very basic element of a web page is a text document written in HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language). A browser runs the web page file and renders the HTML markup. The file The HTML inside the file <p>Hello.</p> The file opened in a web browser That’s it. That’s a web page. No Server Needed You’ll notice the example web page is running on its own. Since front end languages are rendered in the browser you don’t need to have any servers to render the code or compilers to translate anything.
